pages.text: Choiids hail from the Middle Cambrian into the Lower Silurian, with fossils found in the Burgess Shale, Canada; Maotianshan shales, China; Wheeler Shale, USA and Fezouata formation, Morocco. It is conical shaped sponge with a myriad of spines radiating out, suspended above the seafloor by stalk-like spines, and grew up to 3 cm in diameter.
The generic name possibly derives from the Spanish word 'Cholla', which is the nickname of a spikey cactus genus known as 'Cylindropuntia'.
